name: Lamb Rogan Josh
history: Rogan Josh is a classic dish from Kashmiri cuisine, tracing its roots back to Persia. It's a staple of Indian cuisine, known for its aromatic and rich flavors. Lamb Rogan Josh, in particular, is celebrated for its tender meat and spicy gravy.
description: Lamb Rogan Josh is a flavorful curry made with tender pieces of lamb, simmered in a rich, aromatic sauce. The dish is characterized by its deep red color, traditionally from Kashmiri red chilies, and a blend of spices including cardamom, cinnamon, and bay leaves.

equipment.name: pressure cooker or pot
equipment.description: Optional, for faster cooking of the lamb.

ingredients.item: whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaves)
ground spices (coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala)

instructions.title: Marinate the Lamb
instructions.description: Marinate the lamb pieces in yogurt, salt, and some of the ground spices. Set aside for at least 1 hour or overnight in the refrigerator.

instructions.title: Cook Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil or ghee in a pan. Add whole spices and sautÃ© until fragrant. Add onions and cook until golden. Stir in ginger-garlic paste.

instructions.title: Add Lamb and Simmer
instructions.description: Add the marinated lamb to the pan and cook on high heat for a few minutes. Add tomato puree, remaining ground spices, and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the lamb is tender.

instructions.title: Final Touches
instructions.description: Once the lamb is cooked and the gravy has thickened, adjust seasoning. Optionally, add saffron for flavor and color.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve hot with rice or naan.

tips: For a richer flavor, use ghee instead of oil.
Ensure the lamb is marinated well for tenderness.
variations: Add cream or coconut milk for a creamier texture.
Replace lamb with beef or chicken for a different version of the dish.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish.
Garnish with a sprinkle of garam masala or fresh herbs for added aroma.
